website_summaries.verdict: The SBR-AC3200P, when coupled with the SBX-AC1200 power line Wi-Fi extender, is a sure way to cover your residential home with Wi-Fi, if you can stomach their combined high cost.
pros: The Arris SurfBoard SBR-AC3200P works as both a Wi-Fi router and as a fast power line adapter
The router is compact and includes a mobile app for easy setup
cons: The router is expensive and has short Wi-Fi range, natively
The power line Wi-Fi extender, which helps to increase the range, costs an extra $100

customer_reviews.title: Move along is my suggestion
customer_reviews.text: Died in three months. Buyer beware. It is also a complete turd monster to set up with custom passwords and other settings unless you are EXTREMELY savvy. Some folks had better experiences. When it worked it worked well but it didn't work for long unfortunately. Spent time on the line with tech support just to get it started which says a lot...I wasn't even trying to do anything custom to get it inline.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Check out other sites
customer_reviews.text: Very bad ARRIS ad; inappropriate info. For example, following the instructions are very easy. However, no additional benefits after parring with ARRIS modem and then placing in another room. Thus, when calling support, it was inferred that another ARRIs product was necessary (for proper extension). I have this one (SBX-1000P) and yet it was emphasized that an ARRIS SBXAC 1200 was (also) required. My SBX would be hard wired and (2) the 1200 could be placed in another room. No such info was seen and/or emphasized. I might be a decent idea to consume reviews and then checking other companies.
customer_reviews.author: B. Chapinski

customer_reviews.title: Very Complicated
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I waited this long to write a review hoping I can get my issues resolved. I've contacted tech support several times and spent hours on the phone to only repeat installation over and over and even swapped devices. New devices the same. It is not user friendly in setting up. Using electrical wiring in a home not recommended. My devices are less then 25 feet apart and signals are very weak. This product is not worth the price or the time.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Marginally better signal strength, not a bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: This warehouse deal arrived with a funny rattling part (loose piece) inside, but the unit did operate. I didn't like the way the Wireless Access Point was presented to the WiFi receiver, where I could not select the separate 2 GHz band aside from the 5 GHz band. Both seemed to be shown as equivalent WiFi networks (a single option in my Available Wireless Network selections). I did not experience a noticeably better signal, but this may work better with extender units which it is designed to support.
customer_reviews.author: Burndoubt

customer_reviews.title: Blazing speeds
customer_reviews.text: Wow is it fast! I had a netgear n600 router and it was bogging down my internet. This arris coupled woth my surfboard modem is blazing fast. Using Comcast blast internet package. See speedtest photo. Also super easy set up. I bought this refurbed here on amazon and it came with no manual, it was still super easy to setup. I had to google the default router password and username but that only took one try to get a good google hit.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Aside from the terrible setup instructions
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the terrible setup instructions, if you're planning to use this between house and garage even if on the same electrical circuit, forget it, it won't work and the company's Tier one and Tier two tech support cannot help you either as they don't really understand how it works and why it won't work on a 60 amp single phase circuit to the garage. What an unhappy and miserable experience i have had with these devices
customer_reviews.author: sandho

customer_reviews.title: I needed to replace my old Cisco Router for higher ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old Cisco Router for higher speed. I ordered the ARRIS SURFboard AC3200 Wi-Fi Router to restore connection to my television in my living room which kept freezing the picture, but it did some help in resolving it. I thought the laptop would go wireless, but instead, this router is actually used for dial-up and I could not get any wireless connection. I had to order a long wired cable to get the laptop connected. I live in a small apartment and the only thing that could go wireless are my two smartphones. I have an ARRIS SURFboard SB6183 Modem that is compatible with this router and they both work well.
customer_reviews.author: Wynell A.

customer_reviews.title: I found the cord to be too short compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: I found the cord to be too short compared to other modems, not sure why they wouldn't lengthen it just to avoid any issues, also it falls over occasionally the base is unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Capra

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal with easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This has proved to be more powerful than I thought it would be. Setup was very, very easy. That may be why this brand is used by so many cable companies. The instructions provide are more picture oriented than writing orientated which is helpful. I used this to get some of my extended family switched over to a new cable company. The quality of the equipment and it's excellent performance left a good impression.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Set-up Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Total Garbage. Very difficult to set-up and then it failed to work. The app to set-up would not pair, the device would not pair, I will never get the hour I spent setting this up back but you can. Do not buy this router. Save yourself time and get an apple airport extream for the same price and you will be up and running in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: fravid

customer_reviews.title: Not Working For Me
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to work for me as advertised. It may be that I have wrong SurfBoard modem/router unit and there has a problem. Anyway, unless you want to reboot the router and these every day. It might not work for you. (MINE: ARRIS SURFboard SBG7580AC Docsis 3.0 Cable Modem/ Wi-Fi AC1750 Router )
customer_reviews.author: rcarey

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy more than one extender and don't expect good performance from that
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy more than one extender and don't expect good performance from that. i bought six, wish I never had. The router was okay, but the power line extenders failed consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Talk

customer_reviews.title: I bought this Arris Surfboard Wired Network Extender and also ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Arris Surfboard Wired Network Extender and also the Arris Surfboard AC1200 Wi-Fi "Hotspot". They work together in my house. Before I bought these, I had tried to get stronger Wi-Fi signal on the second floor of my house. Nothing worked well. These Arris products solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nancye from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The modem/router provided by Comcast kept dropping the connection in addition to a significant speed drop. My house has steel framing, so it tends to cause interference. With this router, I have no speed drops any where in the house. I have Smart TVs throughout the house, and it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Finally an extender that works!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, signal is loud and clear from the router at the opposite end of my 2 story house. Was getting 3 - 5 mbps now ps4 shows 28mbps and Samsung tv streams 4k content without a problem. My router does not have ripcurrent so I had to purchase 2 extenders but wow is it worth it!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product with an amazing technology
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a total of 4 It is insanely increases the range of my WiFi without sacrificing any speed or the bandwidth. Fantastic product with an amazing technology. I have zero dead spots any where in or around my property. Would certainly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Moudy Youssef

customer_reviews.title: Good but not as good as they claim.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. It does not have the range they say it does. We have 1800 square feet and it barely reaches to the other end of the house. 11000, I hardly think so.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hamende

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Is not as easy to install as explained. Even with directions given, could not get it to work
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those dead zones.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! We had a dead zone in the house and this did the trick. Easy to set up and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly! With a number of the receivers I have solid connections all over the house even the garage!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Patterson

customer_reviews.title: ... arris surfboard refurbished in August of 2017 it worked fine for 3 months now it just quit working and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the arris surfboard refurbished in August of 2017 it worked fine for 3 months now it just quit working and I am stuck with a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like it stated using the house wiring
customer_reviews.text: It did not improve my wifi , like it stated using the house wiring !! A waste of my money !!
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY ARESTA

customer_reviews.title: ... it has allowed me to watch tv clearer and better on my smart
customer_reviews.text: With me ordering this portable hotspot it has allowed me to watch tv clearer and better on my smart tv
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great to move my WAP more central and used power lines as back-haul back to modem - internet.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solver.......
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to set up, but definitely worth the effort!!........
customer_reviews.author: Robert Borries

customer_reviews.title: Solid firewall/wifi
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best firewalls/wifi units I've purchased . Solid connections so far.. great range throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Wish you could change the ", 1" address to ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish you could change the ",1" address to something else, it interfered with the router. Seems to work reasonably well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy in TN

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: These are totally worth it as opposed to the competition
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as well as advertised. The signal ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as well as advertised. The signal is still not strong about a 6 on a scale from 1 to 10. I bought a a second extender and the signal is exactly the same a 6
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy setup hard to detetmine why throughput is not optimal
customer_reviews.text: easy setup hard to detetmine why throughput is not optimal
customer_reviews.author: steven rogers

customer_reviews.title: speed test indicates excellent download/upload speed improvement
customer_reviews.text: eliminated intermittent internet service problems will previous router and cable modem. speed test indicates excellent download/upload speed improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Very good extender a must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good extender I was not able to put it to the test as it was not compatible with my router
customer_reviews.author: kb0sdq

customer_reviews.title: Wasted days trying to get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it came up under "People also Bought" when I bought the ARRIS SURFboard SBG6900AC Docsis 3.0 16x4 Cable Modem/ Wi-Fi AC1900 Router. What it didn't say they don't work together.
customer_reviews.author: The Campaign HQ

customer_reviews.title: Best Wi-Fi router does not make it through my entire ...
customer_reviews.text: Best Wi-Fi router does not make it through my entire house so I went with another brand. Unfortunately I waited too long to return it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gupsu

customer_reviews.title: Requires more than one
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. Better off getting a cheap router as a WiFi extender.
customer_reviews.author: John C Basinger

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: They do not tell you it does not work unless you purchase there Router !!!
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: After 1. 5 hours with tier 1 and another ...
customer_reviews.text: After 1.5 hours with tier 1 and another 45 mins with tier 2, they never could get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bowers

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst router I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst router I ever bought. I can't go outside or upstairs without dropping the signal. My old one died but I could go all over the house and out side. I wish I didn't wait so long to hook it up so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Don b.

customer_reviews.title: Too slow, doesn't really work.
customer_reviews.text: This item doesn't work as described. In order to make it work it has to be plugged in near the router so there's no point. Yes I was able to make it work, but unless it's plugged into an outlet in the same room it's so slow it's worthless. Do yourself a favor, run a network cable to the other side of the house and setup another wifi router or access point and be done.
customer_reviews.author: Mastermynd

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Can't get it to work.. gonna have to call support when I finally have 2 minutes to rub together.
customer_reviews.author: E. James Robinson

customer_reviews.title: made internet crash
customer_reviews.text: this item was Recommended by arris to extend the reach of out wifi coverage. very difficult to install and sync, took several technicians at arris to help us over a series of days. they even told me they are not totally sure how to use this .when it finally worked it did reach the far end of the house but made the entire internet in the house wifi and direct wire to fail several times a day requiring a total reboot several times a day. do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rowland

customer_reviews.title: and they SUCK. ALL THREE OF THE SAME BRAND AND NOTHING ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a surfboard modem/router and 2 Arris surfboard devices, and they SUCK. ALL THREE OF THE SAME BRAND AND NOTHING WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Hightower

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned extender because it would not work with my router.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Begil

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE BUYING!
customer_reviews.text: Was lied to from Arris support, stating it would be compatible with the SBG650. IT IS NOT! Do not purchase unless you already own the SBR series. Customer service is a nightmare when dealing with Arris.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ARRIS Surfboard AC3200 Wi-Fi Router with RipCurrent Using G.hn (SBR-AC3200P)
product_meta.description: Size:AC1900 WiFi| Style:Router / AC3200 WiFi w G.hnThe SURFboard SBR-AC3200P with RipCurrent will satisfy your need for speed. With Wi-Fi speeds up to 1900 Mbps, it's perfect for gaming, streaming, surfing and sharing anywhere in your home. The unique industrial design allows for 6 internal antennas strategically set for high-quality performance and operates tri-band concurrently to insure maximum speeds are maintained on all your Wi-Fi devices. Built in RipCurrent G.hn powerline technology allows optional SURFboard RipCurrent Hotspots and Extenders to expand coverage to any area of your home thru existing outlets. Now that is truly Wi-Fi without limits!
feature_bullets: AC3200 Wi-Fi speeds up to 3200 Mbps- Tri-band concurrent N450+ AC1350+ AC1350 Mbps speeds
6 high-performance antenna with Wi-Fi Beamforming for maximum coverage and performance
4 Gigabit Ethernet ports & Fast, secure USB 2.0 port and USB 3.0 ports
RipCurrent utilizes your home’s existing power lines via G.hn technology to expand your network. NOTE: 2 RipCurrent devices are required to utilize G.hn networking
Compatible with SURFboard RipCurrent Wi-Fi HotSpots and Network Extenders (sold separately) Any Outlet. Any room. It just works!
Easy Wi-Fi Network Setup / WPS Wi-Fi protected setup for easy Wi-Fi pairing
2-Year Limited Warranty with USA Technical Support: 877-466-8646

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.8 out of 5 stars92 ratings2.8 out of 5 stars
